intro: Oxytropis barkultagi, commonly known as the Altai milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its upright growth habit and compound leaves. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers that are typically yellow or pale green in color. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in steppes and rocky soils. Oxytropis barkultagi is also known for its ability to fix nitrogen in the soil, contributing to soil fertility.
